main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Greenville, Ohio on October 7, 1966, described as a very bright yellow light.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about one hour,The object was stationary but initially appeared very large,The observer later concluded that the object might have been Sirius,The observer used binoculars to examine the object closely,The sighting involved meteorological conditions that were clear, supporting visibility.
witness description: A civilian observer who reported the sighting and filled out a questionnaire about the event.
